job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Franklin, IN
pros: Small. Good communication between staff
cons: Small, not enough help at times

pros: The hospital is small enough to enable you to get to know nearly everyone that works here.  They have retirement matching, tuition reimbursement, and paid time off. The cafeteria has good food, and is very inexpensive.
cons: It's no longer about the patients, and it's definitely not about the employees, it's all about the bottom dollar.  Hospital makes expansions, but closes other departments, and wont invest in employee education opportunities or equipment upgrades  for current services.  Some in management have no education, it's very strange. Hospital does not replace terminated employees, the less staff the better.

pros:
Make sure you're reviewing the right hospital - this is the Johnson Memorial in FRANKLIN, INDIANA. Nice people to work with, pay has always been competitive (they compare pay rates for all jobs to regional averages), I have so much PTO that I frequently reach max level and *have* to take days off. 
CEO and some leadership recently changed, things were going well before, but even better now. Great direction and vision.
cons: With low reimbursement from insurers, especially Medicare, and cuts to funding, healthcare isn't in great shape. Hospitals everywhere are struggling.

pros: Working PRN in the lab allows you to schedule yourself most of the time around the needs of the lab and your home life.
cons: Management does not care about you. They buddy up with certain members of the team and leave everyone else to fend for themselves. They allow certain employees to bring children to work but then they won't allow others. I dreaded going to work everyday, it was like something out of Mean Girls. (movie)

pros: Small university town with lots of staff from the town of Franklin.  Pay is competitive with being close to Indianapolis.
cons: Nursing leadership poor - nurses shared this information on a survey and once the survey results came in, administration buried the report.  Earned paided time off - when you quit, administration keeps half of the balance. Poor support of staff.  When the local paper had an article on the CEO's salary, he came around and picked up all the newspapers at the nurses stations so staff and patients would not notice.

review_title: My job experience at Johnson Memorial Hospital
pros: Very pleasant work environment having a big hospital feel to itself in a small community setting
cons: having to working every 3rd weekend and not getting staff support for projects that are win-win for the pharmacy and the hospital overall
